description:
How is server listing with all_tenants supposed to work with Keystone domains?  If I'm an admin of Domain1, I'm likely not an admin of Domain2.   So, presumably all_tenants in a Domain1 project should list all projects under Domain1, but not those under Domain2.

But I thought nova wasn't aware of Keystone domains (?)...

How is this supposed to work?
title: Behaviour of all_tenants with Keystone V3 Domains?

comments.content:
How is server listing with all_tenants supposed to work with Keystone domains?  If I'm an admin of Domain1, I'm likely not an admin of Domain2.   So, presumably all_tenants in a Domain1 project should list all projects under Domain1, but not those under Domain2.

But I thought nova wasn't aware of Keystone domains (?)...

How is this supposed to work?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content:
Can you post the question to the mailing list?

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Mailing_Lists#General_List
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: Given the answer to the question, converting back to a bug to track support for domain admins & domain boundaries in all_tenants.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content:
Russell - is this a phrasing issue, or do you actually think this isn't a bug?

If it's a phrasing issue: all_tenants does not honor Keystone V3 domains.  Nova grants admin rights to domain 1, if I am an admin of the domain 2.

Am I misunderstanding what domains are for?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb
